intro: Kolobopetalum auriculatum, commonly known as the ear-shaped flower tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, auriculate (ear-shaped) petals. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers, which bloom in clusters, are yellowish-white with a distinctive, heart-shaped base, making it a visually striking ornamental plant.
